normalised: Bollywood Releases: Brace Yourselves, Box Office!

unnormalised: Mumbai: Bollywood is unleashing a tsunami of films this Diwali season, threatening to drown our wallets and our sanity. First up is "Munnabhai MBBS: The Prequel," which, according to sources (read: Raju's chaiwala near Film City), will finally explain why Munna went to medical school in the first place. Spoiler alert: probably involved a dare and Rs. 500.
normalised: Mumbai: Bollywood is unleashing a tsunami of films this Diwali season, threatening to drown our wallets and our sanity. First up is "Munnabhai M B B S: The Prequel," which, according to sources (read: Raju's chaiwala near Film City), will finally explain why Munna went to medical school in the first place. Spoiler alert: probably involved a dare and rupees five hundred.

unnormalised: Then we have "Dhoom 5: Desi Drift," promising even more gravity-defying stunts on Bandra-Worli Sea Link – this time, they're swapping bikes for auto-rickshaws! Expect traffic jams to worsen considerably from its scheduled release on 27/10/2024.
normalised: Then we have "Dhoom five: Desi Drift," promising even more gravity-defying stunts on Bandra-Worli Sea Link – this time, they're swapping bikes for auto-rickshaws! Expect traffic jams to worsen considerably from its scheduled release on twenty seventh october two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: And if that wasn't enough, Karan Johar is back with "Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Kal Ho Naa Ho 2: Electric Boogaloo," a sequel nobody asked for but apparently needed. Initial screenings suggest that audience members will require tissues (again!) and possibly sedatives. Available in cinemas from 03/11/2024, showings at 11:00 AM and 03:00 PM daily. Word on the street ( Linking Road, specifically) is that SRK makes a cameo as a particularly flamboyant chai vendor. May God (and box office collections) have mercy on us all! Remember to book your tickets by 26/10/2024 to avoid disappointment!
